review: It's nice and small, games are fun.  It seems that you need a cable subscription for some of the apps to work. otherwise your paying around the same price as cable to watch a few channels.  Also they are over 2 seasons behind on most of the sitcoms my wife likes to watch.  so we have to keep our cable service or pay $3 per show.  I was hoping I was going to save some money converting to Amazon Fire TV but it is pretty much the same if not more than cable TV.  The only thing that I uses it for really is to play games that I received for free when I bought the product. It is cheaper that a PlayStation or Xbox but if you have one they I wouldn't waste your money.

review: I use Amazon Fire TV to watch Netflix steaming movies.  When I pause to read the subtitle a information bar pops up at the bottom of the screen basically blocking the subtitle which negates the purpose of pausing.  I have Apple TV on the other room with second TV and I never get this issue.  Actually when I watch Amazon prime movie I don't have issue either.  Only with the Netflix application it does that.  As a result I rarely use Fire TV instead I watch Apple TV in the other room.
